content.title: Paraneoplastic Vascular Manifestations
content.description: Vascular phenomena occurring as remote effects of malignancy, including hypercoagulability and vasculitis.

manifestations.trousseau_syndrome: Migratory thrombophlebitis associated with occult malignancy
manifestations.hypercoagulability: DVT/PE, arterial thrombosis in unusual sites

evaluation.when_to_suspect: Unexplained thrombosis, especially recurrent or unusual location

content.clinical_pearl: Unprovoked thrombosis, especially migratory or recurrent despite anticoagulation, warrants malignancy workup
content.statement: Paraneoplastic Vascular Manifestations is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Pathology Rare-Syndromes that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.
